poem:
"Border Blues"

Brexit's shelf-life short, say those with knowledge,
Shrinking fifth in edible homage,
EU's bounty wilting in transit's cage.
Tick-tock travels the trade age.

From mainland's heart to our British plate,
Through checkerboard gates, freight waits, 
Turns stale what once was great.
Time ebbs, patience abates, 
It's the vapid truth we navigate.

Bite on this- fresh food's fate.
